documentType: grand jury subpoena and non-disclosure order
summary: This document is a sealed grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Facebook, Inc., compelling the production of all records associated with Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts. It includes a non-disclosure order preventing Facebook from notifying Maxwell or others about the subpoena for 365 days, citing concerns about jeopardizing the investigation. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking and transportation for illegal sexual activity.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena to Facebook, Inc. as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Sarah Netburn
persons.context: Signed the non-disclosure order, granting the government's request to prevent Facebook from disclosing the subpoena's existence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all records for any accounts registered to or associated with her name, phone numbers, and email addresses.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the grand jury investigation for which Maxwell is a target, as evidenced by the subpoena for her records.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to Facebook
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a sealed grand jury subpoena to Facebook, Inc., demanding records related to Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts.

events.title: Court Grants Non-Disclosure Order
events.description: Magistrate Judge Sarah Netburn grants a 2705(b) order, prohibiting Facebook from notifying anyone about the subpoena for 365 days to prevent flight, evidence tampering, or witness intimidation.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance for Facebook
events.description: The subpoena commands Facebook to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records by this date.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building (One St. Andrew's Plaza), New York, New York 10007
Facebook, Inc. Headquarters, 1601 Willow Road, Menlo Park, California 94025
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: The U.S. government issued a sealed grand jury subpoena to Facebook on November 21, 2019, specifically targeting all account records associated with Ghislaine Maxwell.

A federal magistrate judge issued a non-disclosure order preventing Facebook from notifying Maxwell or any third party about the subpoena for 365 days, citing risks of flight, evidence destruction, witness intimidation, and jeopardizing the investigation.

The underlying criminal investigation involves suspected violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 371 (conspiracy), and 2423 (transportation for illegal sexual activity).
The subpoena rider details an extensive list of records requested, including subscriber info, session logs, payment methods, correspondence, and call/text records.
The document reveals the ongoing and covert nature of the federal investigation into Maxwell as of late 2019, prior to her arrest in July 2020.
